page.title: 01SURVEY OF AREA
page.content: {Belgrave}is a heavily populated area on the northern side of the city of Leicester.Until the 1860s it was a village separate from city.The village grew rapidly at the end of the 19th. century and the area is now almost completely built up.Belgrave is now described as a multi-cultural area with a large number of immigrants from the New Commonwealth (mainly from the Indian sub-continent).{Thurmaston}is a commuter village for Leicester and is barely separate from the city.The long straggling main street has now been by-passed.The village is quite industrial.{Barkby Thorpe}is mainly arable land but new housing estates are beginning to infringe.The village of{Humberstone}has now been totally engulfed by the city and contains a great deal of council housing.
